title: Chris Evans takes on former KKK leader David Duke
text:
John Salangsang/Invision/AP
Chris Evans.
By Heather Ciras Globe Staff February 14, 2017
It seems like something right out of a blockbuster summer movie: Captain America vs. the former imperial wizard of the KKK.
After David Duke criticized “Captain America” actor Chris Evans on Twitter, Evans shot back on Twitter.
Advertisement
Duke, an ardent white supremacist, posted four photos of Evans, a Sudbury native, standing with four different women, including his recent ex-girlfriend, comedian and actress Jenny Slate , from Milton, and Naomie Harris , an actress to whom he was once romantically linked.
Duke asked in the post why Evans hated “the women of his people.”
Get The Weekender in your inbox: The Globe's top picks for what to see and do each weekend, in Boston and beyond. Sign Harris is a black British actress. Slate is Jewish.
Duke is a Holocaust denier who became increasingly outspoken in his support for Donald Trump during the run-up to the presidential election.
Evans wasn’t having it:
I don't hate them. That's YOUR method. I love. Try it. It's stronger than hate. It unites us. I promise it's in you under the anger and fear https://t.co/RGnH4rrblq
— Chris Evans (@ChrisEvans) February 13, 2017
Advertisement
Evans continued tweeting:
We can't let hatred be the loudest voice. https://t.co/bqRPRXo453
— Chris Evans (@ChrisEvans) February 9, 2017
Evans hasn’t been shy about sharing his feelings about Duke. After Duke tweeted support of Attorney General Jeff Sessions , Evans had this to say:
If David Duke....DAVID!...DUKE!... thinks you're right, then you are unequivocally wrong. The confirmation of @jeffsessions is beyond words. https://t.co/CuLUznwO6S
— Chris Evans (@ChrisEvans) February 9, 2017
